verbose_text: Mechanistically, binding of AMP to the gamma-subunit allows a small regulatory segment of the alpha-subunit (alpha2 residues 365-371) called the alpha-hook or alpha-RIM2 to directly interact with bound AMP and create an allosteric conformational change at the catalytic active site.
evidence: AMP to the gamma-subunit allows a small regulatory segment of the alpha-subunit (alpha2 residues 365-371) called the alpha-hook or alpha-RIM2
